title: Space Systems Command refines front-door concept
summary: The U.S. Space Systems Command is continuing to refine its concept for establishing a single point of contact for commercial innovators called the front door.

title: NASA denies SpaceX Crew Dragon propellant leak report, reveals unrelated heat shield defect
summary: In a partial response to a report alleging evidence of several significant anomalies during a recent private astronaut launch that could affect...

title: NASA Awards Contract to National Academy of Sciences
summary: NASA has awarded a sole-source contract to the National Academy of Sciences of Washington to conduct studies on questions of national importance within the domain of NASA science and technology programs relating to space science, Earth science, and biological and physical science in space.

title: NASA Awards Contract to National Academy of Science
summary: NASA has awarded a sole-source contract to the National Academy of Science of Washington to conduct studies on questions of national importance within the domain of NASA science and technology programs relating to space science, Earth science, and biological and physical science in space.

title: SpaceX swapping heat shield for next crew flight due to ‘manufacturing defect’
summary: SpaceX’s next crew mission to the International Space Station, set for launch in September, will fly with a different heat shield structure than originally planned after the Dragon spacecraft’s composite substrate failed during acceptance testing, NASA said Tuesday.

title: AWS picks 10 startups for 2022 space accelerator
summary: Amazon Web Services announced May 24 it has picked 10 startups to join its second annual space accelerator program, which helps early-stage companies learn how to grow their businesses with cloud and analytic technologies.

title: BlueHalo wins $1.4 billion contract to upgrade U.S. satellite control network
summary: The Space Rapid Capabilities Office awarded BlueHalo a $1.4 billion contract to add satellite communications capacity to the ground network used by the U.S. military to command and control satellites .

title: Starlink’s RV service lets users jump the line for a price
summary: A new Starlink plan lets customers pay more to skip waitlists to connect to its broadband satellites without a fixed address, although connection speeds for other users will be prioritized.

title: NASA-Supported Solar Sail Could Take Science to New Heights
summary: As NASA's exploration continues to push boundaries, a new solar sail concept selected by the agency for development toward a demonstration mission could carry science to new destinations.

title: Azure Space offers Custom Vision tools for satellite imagery
summary: Microsoft is working with partners to identify commercial space applications for the latest software tools the tech giant has developed.
